other_tests.findings: Irradiation of the right eye with 8 mega electron volts administered with a total dose of 45 Gy in 15 fractions of 3 Gy over 5 weeks.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Developed proliferative radiation retinopathy with cotton-wool spots, cystoid macular edema, and intraretinal and vitreous hemorrhages.

other_tests.findings: Removal of vitreous hemorrhages with endolaser photocoagulation and freeze-thaw cryocoagulation applied to tumors.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Resulted in visual acuity improvement to 1.0.

other_tests.findings: Marked fibrotic after-cataract with Elschnig’s pearls.
Specimen showed retinoblastoma cells; IOP measured at 28 mmHg.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Pseudohypopyon was seen to rise to 2.2 mm; VA decreased to 0.63.

other_tests.findings: Irradiation for the second time with a total dose of 45 Gy.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Increased pseudohypopyon height and worsening of visual acuity due to recurrent vitreous hemorrhages.

other_tests.findings: Histopathology showed microcellular retinoblastoma cells in the anterior chamber angle and trabecular meshwork.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Performed due to tumor recurrences and increasing IOP.
